page.title: 03CHANGES IN TEN YEARS DUNLOP
page.content: OVER THE LAST TEN YEARS DUNLOP HAS HAD QUITE A FEW CHANGES, ONE OF WHICH IS THE BUILDING OF MORE HOUSES. SHOPS HAVE BEEN TAKEN OVER BY NEW PEOPLE. THE MAIN ROAD HAS BECOME A LOT BUSIER. THERE ARE FEWER BUSES GOING THROUGH THE VILLAGE AND MORE PEOPLE OWN AND USE CARS. THE POPULATION OF DUNLOP HAS GROWN. THE PETROL STATION HAS BEEN KNOCKED DOWN AND HOUSES HAVE BEEN BUILT THERE. IN 1982 MR.ROBINSON RETIRED AS HEADMASTER AND MRS.CUNNINGHAM WAS APPOINTED. MRS.CUNNINGHAM MADE A LOT OF CHANGES IN THE SCHOOL. THERE ARE NOW MORE ACTIVITIES FOR THE YOUNGSTERS, LIKE THE YOUTH CLUB, UNIFORMED GROUP AND GYMNASTICS.AT THE SAME TIME THERE ARE FEW JOB OPPORTUNITIES FOR SCHOOL LEAVERS.
